title: What’s the difference between a traditional and civil ceremony? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are referring to a marriage ceremony, “traditional” probably means religious. So the difference is whether you are married in a religious ceremony, or legally married by a judge, or a minister who refrains from involving deity in the proceedings. I have performed both Wiccan handfastings and civil ceremonies. The result of becoming legally married is the same.

What kind of ceremony are you asking about? Weddings, funerals or what? Even if we are very secular here in Sweden, the traditional funeral or wedding is a christian ceremony. The difference is if it is a priest/pastor or a civil person who performs the ceremony. In the civil ceremony there is no hymns sung or bible text read, also no praying. The rest is very similar.
